locations: a ruined watchtower covered in glowing moss
a flooded crypt beneath an abandoned chapel
a moonlit forest clearing ringed by standing stones
an underdark tunnel where whispers echo without voices
a desert canyon filled with wind-carved faces
villains: a warlock bound to a hungry relic
a corrupted druid spreading a blight
a baron secretly replaced by a doppelganger
a necromancer collecting names from gravestones
a cult leader promising safety from a coming eclipse
hooks: A traveler begs the party to retrieve a stolen heirloom before midnight.
Villagers report lights moving under the ground like lanterns in a tunnel.
A map appears in a book that none of the party remembers buying.
The local animals have gone silent, and even insects refuse to buzz.
A courier delivers a letter addressed to someone who died years ago.
twists: The monster is protecting something even worse.
The true enemy is a magical contract, not a creature.
A trusted ally is being controlled remotely.
The lair shifts locations each night.
The treasure is cursed to attract predators.
